summary: This is an email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York, dated April 23, 2020. It discusses a probationer who served time and is now being approached by media outlets wanting to talk to him about Epstein, with the probationer expressing interest in participating for potential financial gain. The prosecutor seeks input on whether to take any position regarding this media contact.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Author of the email, seeking advice from colleagues about a probationer's potential media contact regarding Epstein.

persons.name: Probation Officer
persons.context: Reported to the prosecutor that a probationer under their supervision is being approached by media about Epstein.

connections.description: The prosecutor is communicating information received from the Probation Officer about a probationer's situation.

events.title: Probationer's Media Interest Regarding Epstein
events.description: A probationer who recently completed a sentence expressed to his Probation Officer that media outlets want to interview him about Jeffrey Epstein, and he is interested in doing so for potential financial gain.

keyFacts: A probationer who served time was being approached by media outlets for interviews about Jeffrey Epstein as of April 2020.
The probationer expressed a desire to participate in media interviews, motivated by the potential to make money.

The Assistant United States Attorney sought internal advice on whether to take any position or raise concerns about the probationer's media contact, noting it wouldn't affect their own cases but could impact others.
The document indicates ongoing media interest in the Epstein case and individuals connected to it, even after Epstein's death.
